DOC.brief_summary: Severe dental decay affects children physically, emotionally, socially and thereby impacts on their quality of life. Evidence from developed countries showed that children with severe dental decay weighed less than their peers and following dental treatment children's growth and quality of life improved. This suggests that treatment of severe dental decay may enhance growth and wellbeing. A study was carried out in Saudi to test that hypothesis.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Dental Treatment on Children's Growth
DOC.criteria: Having dental caries with at least 2 teeth with pulpal involvement. 1. Children with illness known to adversely affect growth. 2. Children who required urgent dental treatment. 3. Children on regular nutritional supplements. 4. Anaemic children with Hb levels lower than 11.0 g/dl
